revision.comment: /* World War II */ remove space between punctuation and citation
revision.text:
{{Infobox military person | name = Bakir Dursun oglu Mustafayev | native_name = Bəkir Dursun oğlu Mustafayev | image = Bakir Mustafayev.jpg | birth_date = 11 February 1898 | death_date = 10 December 1978 | birth_place = Glazar village, [[Akhaltsikhsky Uyezd]], [[Tiflis Governorate]], [[Russian Empire]] | death_place = [[Kaynama]], [[Samarqand District]], [[Samarqand Region]], [[Uzbek SSR]], [[Soviet Union]] | allegiance = [[Soviet Union]] | branch = [[Red Army]] | serviceyears = 1941–45 | rank = [[Red Army man (rank)|Red Army man]] | unit = [[55th Guards Rifle Division]] | battles = [[World War II]] *[[Battle of the Caucasus]] *[[Kerch-Eltigen Operation]] *[[Crimean Offensive]] | awards = {{Hero of the Soviet Union}}
{{Order of Lenin}} }} '''Bakir Dursun oglu Mustafayev''' (Azerbaijani: Bəkir Dursun oğlu Mustafayev; 11 February 1898 – 10 December 1978) was an [[Azerbaijanis|Azerbaijani]] soldier who served in the Red Army during World War II. Holding the rank of [[Red Army man (rank)|Red Army man]] he was decorated as a [[Hero of the Soviet Union]]. Mustafayev was awarded the title for his actions during the [[Kerch–Eltigen Operation]]. During the operation, Mustafayev reportedly killed 40 German soldiers. For his actions, Mustafayev was awarded the title Hero of the Soviet Union on 16 May 1944. He was discharged after the war and lived in [[Samarqand District]].{{Ruheroes|name=Bakir Mustafayev|id=4573}} == Early life and interwar years == Mustafayev was born on 11 February 1898 in the village of Glazar in what is now [[Akhaltsikhe Municipality]] to a peasant family. He worked in agriculture and was chairman of a [[Kolkhoz|collective farm]].{{Cite book|url=http://az-libr.ru/index.htm?Persons&SLA/fbb3fa31/index|title=Герои Советского Союза: Краткий биографический словарь|last=|first=|publisher=Voenizdat|year=1988|isbn=5203005362|editor-last=Shkadov|editor-first=Ivan|volume=2 Lyubov-Yashchuk|location=Moscow|pages=129|language=Russian|trans-title=Heroes of the Soviet Union: A Brief Biographical Dictionary}} == World War II == Mustafayev was drafted into the Red Army in August 1941. He fought in combat from March 1942, fighting in the [[Battle of the Caucasus]]. Mustafayev became a rifleman in the 5th Rifle Company of the [[55th Guards Rifle Division]]'s 164th Guards Rifle Regiment. In fall 1943, he participated in the Kerch-Eltigen Operation. He crossed the strait with the first group of the regiment. On 3 November, during the battle for Height 102 northeast of [[Kerch]], heavy fire stopped the advance. Mustafayev crawled to a bunker on a height and threw grenades, reportedly killing five German soldiers. His unit then reportedly captured the height. In a battle in a trench, Mustafayev reportedly killed four more German soldiers, captured a machine gun and opened fire on German troops. Mustafayev reportedly hoisted a red flag on Height 102. He was wounded, but reportedly did not leave the battlefield. During the fighting on the Kerch Peninsula, Mustafayev reportedly killed 40 German soldiers. He was evacuated the next day. On 16 May 1944, he was awarded the title Hero of the Soviet Union and the [[Order of Lenin]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.trend.az/life/interesting/1683557.html|title=К 65-летию Великой Победы! Герой Советского Союза Мустафаев Бекир Дурсун оглы - Золотая Звезда Героя проданы на интернет -аукционе|last=|first=|date=7 May 2010|website=|publisher=[[Trend News Agency]]|language=ru-RU|trans-title=65th Anniversary of the Victory! Hero of the Soviet Union Bakir Mustafayev - Gold Star sold in online auction|access-date=8 July 2016}}Hero of the Soviet Union citation, available online at [https://pamyat-naroda.ru/heroes/podvig-chelovek_nagrazhdenie19986155/ pamyat-naroda.ru] In 1944, Mustafayev joined the [[Communist Party of the Soviet Union]]. He fought in the [[Crimean Offensive]]. == Postwar == After the end of the war, Mustafayev was discharged. He lived and worked in the village of Kaynama in Samarqand District. He died on 10 December 1978. A street in Kaynama was named after Mustafayev. In April 2008, his Gold Star and other documents were sold in an online auction. == References == {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mustafayev, Bakir}} [[Category:1898 births]] [[Category:1978 deaths]] [[Category:Soviet military personnel of World War II]] [[Category:People of World War II from Georgia (country)]] [[Category:Heroes of the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of Lenin]] [[Category:Communist Party of the Soviet Union members]] [[Category:People from Tiflis Governorate]]
